	\begin{proof}[Proof of Theorem \ref{Th:log-hyp}]
		Define $X_m := X \times_{{\widetilde{\mathcal{A}}}_g} {\mathcal{A}}_g^{[m]}$. an affine toric variety for the torus $ {\mathbb{G}}_n^k \times {\mathbb{G}}_m^l / H$, and therefore $X_m' \subset  \widetilde X_m'$ is a toroidal embedding as required. 
  
			For~\eqref{item:divs}, we continue with the notation above and note that the logarithmic differential $\frac{dt_1}{t_1}\wedge \cdots  \wedge\frac{dt_k}{t_k} \wedge dy_1 \wedge \cdots \wedge dy_l$ generates the stalk of logarithmic canonical differentials on the completion $\widehat{{\overline{X}}'}_x$. Writing $u_i^m = t_i$, this differential pulls back to  $\frac{m\,du_1}{u_1}\wedge \cdots  \wedge\frac{m\,du_k}{u_k} \wedge dy_1 \wedge \cdots \wedge dy_l$, which generates the stalk on $\hat Y:={\operatorname{Spf}} {\mathbb{C}}\llbracket \sqrt[n]{t_1},\ldots,\sqrt[n]{t_k}, y_1,\ldots,y_l\rrbracket$. Since the pullback maps of stalks along $\hat Y \to \widehat{({\overline{X}}'_m)}_{x_m} \to \widehat{{\overline{X}}'}_x$ are injective this element generates the stalk on the intermediate stage $\widehat{({\overline{X}}'_m)}_{x_m}$, as needed.
  
			Statement~\eqref{item:big} is a general fact about generically finite maps, see the argument of \cite[Theorem 1.5]{Debarre}: let $f\colon Y \to X$ be a dominant generically finite map  between reduced projective schemes of pure dimension $d$ and let $A$ be a divisor on $X$. Then $A$ is big if and only if $f^*A$ is big. As {\sc Robert Lazarsfeld} put it, this statement - in the form $\operatorname{vol}( f^* A) = \deg (f) \operatorname{vol}(A)$ - should have been in his books but isn't. To prove this it suffices to consider the case when $X$ is irreducible.   First, if $A$ is big then $h^0(X,{\mathcal{O}}_X(mA)) = C m^d+ l.o.t$, and
for any irreducible component $Y'$ of $Y$, so

nexttext:
In particular the integer $l$ occuring there is 0.

		In this case, in the notation of \cite[p. 255]{Mumford}, ${\mathscr{D}}_F = {\mathscr{D}}(F)$ is the space $U(F)_{\mathbb{C}}$ of all symmetric $g\times g$ complex matrices, and $U(F)$ acts by translation by the real symmetric matrices  $B$. We have $\Gamma = Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}})$, and $U(F) \cap \Gamma$ is the additive group of symmetric $g\times g$ integer matrices $B$. Let $\Gamma(m) = \ker(Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}}) \to Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}}/m{\mathbb{Z}}))$, and note that $U(F) \cap \Gamma(m)$ is the additive group of symmetric $g\times g$ integer matrices divisible by $m$.

		Finally, in the notation of \cite[p. 272]{Mumford}, we have

In particular the integer $l$ occuring there is 0.

		In this case, in the notation of \cite[p. 255]{Mumford}, ${\mathscr{D}}_F = {\mathscr{D}}(F)$ is the space $U(F)_{\mathbb{C}}$ of all symmetric $g\times g$ complex matrices, and $U(F)$ acts by translation by the real symmetric matrices  $B$. We have $\Gamma = Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}})$, and $U(F) \cap \Gamma$ is the additive group of symmetric $g\times g$ integer matrices $B$. Let $\Gamma(m) = \ker(Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}}) \to Sp_{2g}({\mathbb{Z}}/m{\mathbb{Z}}))$, and note that $U(F) \cap \Gamma(m)$ is the additive group of symmetric $g\times g$ integer matrices divisible by $m$.

		Finally, in the notation of \cite[p. 272]{Mumford}, we have

nexttext: Similarly ${\mathscr{D}}(F) / U(F)\cap \Gamma(m) = {\mathbb{C}}^{g(g+1)/2} / (m{\mathbb{Z}})^{g(g+1)/2} = ({\mathbb{C}}^*)^{g(g+1)/2}$, with similar chart in the smooth toroidal compactification of ${\mathcal{A}}_g^{[m]}$. The group $\Gamma/\Gamma(m)\simeq ({\mathbb{Z}}/m{\mathbb{Z}})^{g(g+1)/2}$ acts by $m$-th roots of unity on each variable.

		Let $x \in {\overline{X}}'$ be a complex point with image $f(x) \in E$, and let $x_m \in {\widetilde{X}}'_m$ be a point with $p_1(x_m) = x$.
